intro: Cavendishia chocoensis var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy Cavendishia, is a rare and striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy inflorescences that range from red to orange. The plant's name refers to the dense, hairy covering on its leaves, which gives it a unique, textured appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
